contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|Vancouver}} '''[[Vancouver]]''' is a major city in British Columbia, Canada. '''Vancouver''' may also refer to: ==Places== * [[Vancouver, Washington]], USA ** [[Vancouver Lake]], lake in Vancouver, Washington ** [[Fort Vancouver]], 19th-century fur trading post, located in present-day Vancouver, Washington * [[Vancouver Island]], British Columbia, Canada * [[East Vancouver]], region within Vancouver, British Columbia * [[Metro Vancouver]], metropolitan area centred around Vancouver, British Columbia ** [[Greater Vancouver]], area centred around the city * [[Mount Vancouver]], on the Yukon-Alaska border * [[Mount Vancouver, New Zealand]], in the Southern Alps on the South Island, New Zealand * [[North Vancouver]], British Columbia, Canada, two distinct municipalities in Metro Vancouver ** [[North Vancouver (city)]], incorporated 1907 ** [[North Vancouver (district municipality)]], incorporated 1891 * [[West Vancouver]], British Columbia, Canada, incorporated 1912, part of Metro Vancouver * [[Vancouver Bay, British Columbia]], a locality and former cannery town on Jervis Inlet * [[Vancouver River]], a river emptying into Prince of Wales Reach of Jervis Inlet ==People== *[[George Vancouver]], British naval officer and explorer ==Vessels== * [[Vancouver (steamboat)|''Vancouver'' (steamboat)]], a cargo steamer owned and operation by the Hudson's Bay Company * [[HMCS Vancouver (F6A)|HMCS ''Vancouver'' (F6A)]], Royal Canadian Navy S-class destroyer * [[HMCS Vancouver (FFH 331)|HMCS ''Vancouver'' (FFH 331)]], Canadian Forces ''Halifax''-class frigate * [[USS Vancouver (LPD-2)|USS ''Vancouver'' (LPD-2)]], US Navy ''Raleigh''-class amphibious transport dock ==Other== * [[Vancouver (electoral districts)]] * [[Vancouver Expedition]], five-year voyage commanded by George Vancouver in 1791 * [[Vancouver system]], style of referencing * [[Bobby Taylor and the Vancouvers]], 1960s-vintage Motown band * [[Vancouver (Matthew Good album)|''Vancouver'' (Matthew Good album)]], 2009 * [[Vancouver (EP)|''Vancouver'' (EP)]], 2006 EP by post-hardcore band La Dispute * [[Vancouver Special]], architectural style ==See also== * {{lookfrom|Vancouver}} * {{intitle|Vancouver}} {{disambiguation|geo}}
